intro: Loasa tingomariensis, commonly known as the Tingomari loasa, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
